fields.description:
CAPTCHA is currently keyed by session ID, which is wrong, because if you edit multiple pages at the same time, the CAPTCHA values will clobber each other. We should generate a random number, embed it in the form as a hidden field, then use that to validate the returned CAPTCHA.

A better approach would be to throw out the stored-value stuff, and use one way crypto:

[REDACTED -- this solution won't work]
fields.summary: CAPTCHA gets confused when you're editing two pages at once.

fields.description: When editing a page in the RTE, it would be good to have the ability to highlight a item of text and be able to create a new page using the selected text as a title. This would be a bit more intuitive than leaving the editor and manually creating each page.
fields.summary: Create new pages from within RTE

fields.description:
I am not sure there is a good reason to have the field be so small since there is clearly ample space to the right. Many of our pages have names which are way longer than the space available.
I am surprised this hasn't been addressed yet, as I remember noticing this issue back in 1.4. I would think it'd be extremely easy to address too.
fields.summary: Parent Page field in page Edit screen is clearly too small for comfortable editing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-5976].
  {panel}

=== submitted on behalf of customer

The "deactivate user" feature is missing.

The "reactivate user" feature is missing.

The "show all registered users" feature is missing.

The initial Manage Users page doesn't display any users.

The sorting of users is broken. They are displayed in some "random" order.

There is no facility to filter by group.

There is no facility to view all the users at once or to view a larger number of users per page.

The third column is some strange Repository value instead of the listing of Groups.
fields.summary: "Manage Users" screen is far less functional and has many bugs in 2.1.4 compared to 1.3.5

fields.description:
When viewing a page, sometimes the server will enter a state in which every page viewed does not view the correct content, but instead, views the content of the last page that the user tried to view.  It is somewhat frustrating and requires a server restart to correct.  I am not sure what the cause of the symptoms are.  I should point out that rebuilding the index does not help the issue.

Also, I have customized the software so that a trigger is installed on the bodycontent table so that I can create new pages based on emails that are sent to spaces.  When I look in the database, all of the data/content is there and in the correct spots.  It just seems as though the caching engine is getting confused somewhere.  Any help would be greatly appreciated.

You will note in the screenshot that the title does not match the body.

Thank you,
Sean Harms
fields.summary: Viewing a Page Displays Wrong Content
Need ability to delete multiple child pages from the parent page

fields.description:
Corruption on pasting tables from Word or Excel.   Sometimes they can be pasted and sometime they get destroyed. Did repair a large table using wiki markup. It was a long job are wiki markup does not behave very consistently. A lot of trial and error. 

Examples: 
1. Whenever we have more than one section and the page layout is visible (dotted lines), a copied table (via CMD + C from Excel) gets completely scrambled (only content without any formatting), as soon as I delete the sections so there is only one section I can copy the same thing and have a beautiful table. This seems to be reproducable among different users etc.

2. Pasting Excel tables with headers directly into Confluence will not work. You need to either paste on the second row or remove the header row
fields.summary: Table format corrupts when copy and pasting tables from Excel or Word into WYSIWYG

fields.description:
Make adding images easier, with fewer steps.. also to make it easier to add from Visio or PPT . Add sacrolling to find images that don't fit in window.

To add a diagram first you have to create a JPEG or GIF from say powerpoint or visio.  I did a copy and paste to Paint. 
Then you have to attach the diagram to the page (this puts it into the pages directory).  The you have to find your location in the page, click the add picture button find the picture you want and click it. Go back to the edit screen, make sure the cursor is in the correct place again and repeat for the next diagram. 

If you have attached more than a certain number of images they will not fit in the window and you can't scroll down to find them.
fields.summary: Make adding images easier

fields.description: Using WebDAV. Copying a tree from one space to another. One directory is moved to the wrong place in the heirarchy (one level up)
fields.summary: WebDAV copies to wrong level in heirarchy

fields.description:
From David Peterson on conf-user:

"It would be nice if you had the option of Copying rather than moving (including child pages and attachments, probably not comments though).

"In my case, copying would be useful because I have several spaces which are viewable to different groups of people, but are given the same piece of information at different times. I am a teacher at a high school, so I have one private space where I prepare my assignments, and then each class has it's own space. Often, I reuse assignments between several classes (albeit usually with some small adjustments), however they are usually doing them at different times. It would be good to be able to copy my original page (including attachments and child pages) into the particular class' Space, instead of editing the original, copying the text, pasting it into a new page in the Class's Space, then saving the attachments locally and re-uploading them, and then doing the same for any child pages. It gets slightly annoying after the 5th (or 50th) time..."
fields.summary: Copy page including attachments
News posts does not use configured date format

fields.description:
A workaround to escape emoticons in Confluence would be to create a user macro which only contains the body. Therefore the content wouldn't get rendered. However, when changing between Markup and Rich Text mode, the Rich Text editor adds a paragraph around the macro and therefore makes it impossible to have inline macros.

Example:

Markup Mode

Inline {pre} ;) {pre} Text

> Rich Text:

Inline
{pre} ;) {pre}

Text

> Markup:

Inline
{pre} ;) {pre}
 Text
fields.summary:
Rich Text Editor adds paragraphs (

) around macros

fields.description:
The determination of what constitutes an undefined page needs to be corrected.  Just look at http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/listundefinedpages.action?key=DISC
All the data flagged is within a {noformat} macro.
fields.summary: Determination of undefined pages incorrect

fields.description: I would like to see an {undefined} macro (or argument to {children}) that would allow users the ability to include a list of undefined pages, similar to what is visable in "Browse Space" > "Advanced" > "Undefined Pages". Given that the functionality obviously already exists, it should be simple enough to implement in macro form.
fields.summary: {undefined} macro

fields.description: In order to export a view of a certain "artifact" that consists of many pages you have to go to the space admin area and tick all the pages you want to export.  Every time you need to recreate the document export you have to do this and be sure to click the same pages every time.  Would like a feature where export of a "related group of pages" could be tagged as aa individual artifact for export and import.  Perhaps an external interface (e.g. SOAP Web Services) for scripitng common import/export/change operations.
fields.summary: process to create and recreate consistent exports/pdfs

Allow commas in usernames

fields.description:
From a customer:

Confluence includes an old version of cglib-2.0.jar, that does not appear to be the final version, possibly a release candidate version. Upgrading to cglib-full-2.0.2.jar should fix the problem:
http://www.ibiblio.org/maven/cglib/jars/cglib-full-2.0.2.jar

The final version of cglib-2.0 makes "generated classes have the same protection domain as cglib.jar (have the same signer and code base). It can be useful if hibernate is used in app server with security manager or for Web Start applications."
http://forum.hibernate.org/viewtopic.php?p=2190363

With the old version of cglib, you will get the following error in WebSphere 5.1, even with full permissions in your policy file:

[4/19/06 9:05:51:921 CDT] 143a23d3 SecurityManag W SECJ0314W: Current Java 2 Security policy reported a potential violation of Java 2 Security Permission. Please refer to Problem Determination Guide for further information.
Permission:
      accessDeclaredMembers : access denied (java.lang.RuntimePermission accessDeclaredMembers)
Code:
     com.atlassian.user.impl.hibernate.DefaultHibernateGroup$$EnhancerByCGLIB$$543a4eb1 in {null code URL}
Stack Trace:

fields.description:
The wsdl generated from http://confluence.atlassian.com/rpc/soap-axis/confluenceservice-v1?wsdl is invalid and generates the following WsdlException when running Axis 1.3 WSDL2Java:

I have confirmed that my Axis setup is correct, and have successfully generated types from my Confluence 2.1.5a installation using http://confluence.asgeirnilsen.com/confluence/rpc/soap-axis/confluenceservice-v1?wsdl .

The WSDLs generated from the two urls are attached to this issue.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-5952].
  {panel}

Uploading a PDF attachment using "Attach File" browse button, corrupts the file as it is uploaded.
The resulting file can not be view from the browser. Adobe Reader 7.0 reports "The file is damaged and could not be repaired".
This doesnt happen with all PDFs.

I downed using a binary FTP transfer from the Confluence Data folder to my local machine and that file is corrupt, so the corruption must
occure during the upload/save to disk.

The file that's having problems is an strategic corporate doc, so I can't include it in this posting.
fields.summary: Some PDFs are corrupted after attached to Confluence

fields.summary: Attachment file names can be set to an empty string

fields.description: We have a user macro to e. g. change the background color and such things: span (with body): #set($wiki=$body) #set($type=$param0) #set($arg=$param1) ## ## The following currently does not work ##set($globalHelper=$action.getGlobalHelper()) ##if($content) ##set($renderer=$globalHelper.getWikiStyleRenderer()) ##set($context=$content.toPageContext()) ##set($xhtml=$renderer.convertWikiToXHtml($context, $wiki)) ##else ##set($xhtml=$globalHelper.renderConfluenceMacro($wiki)) ##end ${body}## Using this macro in Wiki Markup: {span:style|background-color:red;}Hello{span}, {span:style|background-color:red;}Hello{span} And then later be edited in RichText will result in: {span:style|background-color:red;}Hello{span} , {span:style|background-color:red;}Hello{span} Which is obviously different from the expected result. There are other examples where Rich Text easily broke layout, so we currently decided to turn this feature off :(
fields.summary: Rich Text Editing destroys layout when using User Macros

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-5949].
  {panel}

When you type enter in the rich text editor, a paragraph is created -- this should be a line break, two of which in succession should produce a paragraph.

In a table, the paragraph is converted to a break, which is inconsistent.

Multiple empty paragraphs should become escaped newlines (\\), but don't.

Most people don't know they can press SHIFT+ENTER to achieve this effect in the RTE. It's not discoverable.
fields.summary: Change default behaviour of enter to a new paragraph (new line, but with no margins). A user can press enter twice to create space between elements.

fields.description:
Mail multiparts are not properly handled by Confluence. They are seen has attachements. 

The consequences are the following: 

- On the search screen, I cannot totally excluded search from mails (search on all content, no mail): The result still shows unnamed-0, unamed-1 results, which are parts of mail (not real attachment, multipart content). 

- -On the result screen, their is a direct link to the attachement. It should be a link to the mail (with the mail title and not unamed-0). This is text and is usually shown inline in most mail readers.- Replaced by CONF-12543
fields.summary: Mail multiparts are included in search results, even if mail is excluded

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-5932].
  {panel}

I don't know if you have used SharePoint but basically if you open a word document that's in SharePoint, Word knows it, and when you save the word doc it saves directly back into SharePoint.
If you could emulate the SharePoint protocol this would be totally kick ass, since then rather than downloading an attachment, updating the document and then re-uploading it, you could just edit it and that rest would be magic :)
I guess the other route would be to offer a webdav link to the document to edit it, since Word does have a mini-webdav redirector, that might work ok.

Being a regular Confluence user I'm not a big believer in Word documents any more, but many are.
fields.summary: SharePoint-like functionality

fields.description:
Some people on our team use wysywig, some people use plaintext. The plaintext people are getting annoyed by the wysiwyg people because every time they touch a page, a ton of reformatting occurs that drives the rest of us nuts:

* Blank lines in the markup often get removed. Those lines are important to keep it all readable.
* Weird things get escaped, and I can't figure out what the rules are for this. For example, I often see \- in the markup. Why does - need to be escaped?
* The wysiwyg editor is _very_ nbsp happy. I see it inserting nbsp's lots of times when only one space is involved. For example:
{noformat}
#* _Beach, Black Sand_ \- still water, black sand, sea grass, bright and sunny.
{noformat}

nbsp's really clutter up the code and make it hard to read.

* I've also seen a bunch of cases where nbsp's are sitting at the end of a line. There's really no reason to keep whitespace (at least when generated by the wysiwyg editor) at the ends of lines.
* Check out this funky thing that someone made with wysiwyg:
{noformat}
 _Note:__ _ _we need a way to define custom/core reports and "mount" them into the system._
{noformat}

Neato.
fields.summary: Whitespace reformatting issues (nbsp's are everywhere)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-5927].
  {panel}

There are a couple of situations where it would be useful to be able to create content on behalf of another user:
1. Administrators often need to be able to post content on behalf of their manager
2. When bringing old content into Confluence it would be ideal to be able to maintain the original author without requiring that author to do the editing themselves

This relates to CONF-1711 which requires similar functionality for managing post dates. I guess what is really needed is a general metadata update privilege. Clearly this should not be a globally available privilege as it can be abused. I'd propose allowing administrators to be able to do this, and they should also to be able to grant permissions to others. It probably also needs to be a per-space setting.
fields.summary: Grant permission to create content on behalf of another user

fields.description:
We have created a DITA to Confluence converter that allows us to export our document set to Confluence. Though far from perfect, the converter has allowed us to export our entire document set to Confluence. We can work outside of Confluence to update and maintain our doc set and we can then export these changes to Confluence. One stumbling block we would like discussed is the unique page name per space limitation.

Basically, our doc set is currently divided into several documents with children pages. Because of our DITA environment, we have setup several common pages that are referenced across all documents (for instance, we have a common copyright page that is used across all of the documents). This works fine when the information in the referenced page is the same across all documents, but this does not work when we have pages that are specific to just one document or set of documents. For instance, we'll have an introduction page for a Windows-related document that is not compatible with the Unix-related document. Currently, the first uploaded introduction page is the one that is used across all document sets so we end up say having the Windows introduction page in the Unix document.

Our current proposed workaround is to have a convoluted page naming system (Introduction to Windows, Introduction to UNIX, etc), though, because of the size of our documentation set, we already see maintenance issues not to mention the creation of pedantic system that would have no benefit to our users (think Confluence Dewey decimal system for page names). Also, because we want to be able to order the pages in a logical order, we will have to add numbers to each page name as it seems the page ordering is still not possible in Confluence (see http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-1031).

Perhaps another workaround would be to have each document be a separate space? However, this will defeat our efforts at having one "documentation space." We can add unique page ids to each page outside of Confluence so that this can be cancelled at the beginning of DITA to confluence conversion process, however, our hands our tied if we can't have multiple versions of the same page name in the same space. Is there any way to enforce or add unique page id metadata that would allow us to create a workaround?

Note: I have looked at several other Page-related issues and other Confluence issues, so hopefully I'm no duplicating this issue.
fields.summary: Unique page names in space limitation

fields.description:
I tried to attached pictures.  After I clicked 'Attach', it seemed like I should click OK and the popup would close.  But it didn't.  It kept prompting me for a file name.  If I cancelled, I finally noticed that the pics were showing up at attachments.  However, I was asked if I wanted the picture aligned left, right or centre.... why ask that if the pic doesn't show up on the main page?  That is very confusing as a user (and I'm a testing analyst by trade).

The attach picture option was not available when I first added a page either but showed up after the page was posted.  This was very confusing.  If I were creating a page for work,  I would like to be able to add the pics when the page is being created.  And I would like to see them embedded - even if just a thumbnail embedded linking to the pic.  

Finally, I did get errors trying to get out of the popup.  These resulted after trying to drag the attached pictures from the popup to the page on the main window.  I had to guess at this since the window wouldn't let me out without canceling.  I had a hard java error and gibberish on the screen. I have captured some of the errors I received - see attached.

This was my test page:  http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/LZkC

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-5914].
  {panel}

It would be useful to have child pages automatically inherit access to attachments from the parent page.

For example, using !red.jpg! or [wordfile.doc] from page X would first access attachment to page X. If no attachment is found on that page with those names, then check the parent page of page X for an attachment with the same name. (and it's parent, etc, to the Home page for the space).

That way, the higher in the heirarchy you attach a file, the more accessible it is in the space, and you don't have to duplicate the file, or use long specific page references (esp. for long page names), and even more important, if you move the child, it inherits a new set of attachments from it's new parent.  You can always override this behaviour by specifying a specific page !mypage^red.jpg!.

alternative:
It might be sometimes useful to go the other way (access child attachments from a parent) but this is more difficult due to the many-to-one relationship, the much larger number of pages to search,  and the possibility of naming conflicts.  In this case, there might not be a good rule to follow. However, in the first case, each child only has one parent, and depths of the page trees tend to be somewhat limited (6 degrees of separation?), so it is clear which file to use and quick to check the parental heirachy axis.

Thanks,
James.
fields.summary: Child pages should 'inherit' parent's attachments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-5913].
  {panel}

For many pages, especially when using the many handy macros and plugins, the wiki markup quickly gets too complex for the beginner user. Nonetheless, these pages often contain blocks of less-complex content that I would like our more beginner users to be able to contribute to.  We can sometimes get around this by using 'includes' and directing our beginner users to the included sections.  However, systematically creating 'includes' for every text-block on a page quickly becomes unscalable, AND the attachments of the parent page are not so easily accessible to the included children.

Suggestion:
1. Create an 'edit this section' or just 'edit' button which appears in the greyed-out header sections of h1. h2. h3. etc headers.  Clicking on this 'edit' button would open up a  WYSIWYG/wiki/preview editor *for that section alone*. Once edited and saved, this section should then be merged seamlessly back into the page. In this manner, people editing separate sections have very little chance of causing a conflict, and people are discouraged from editing (and perhaps 'locking') the entire page if they are just updating a title or paragraph.
2. allow the same sort of tag to be added to {column} tags, as an option. {column:edit=true} or the like.
3. similar for tables, add an 'edit' button along the title line which would only edit that one table. In this case, a special 'table' editor view with quick-buttons to work with the table might be useful (add/delete row/column etc)
4. defined blocks: {editable}this text will have an 'edit' button before or after it, and be editable as a block{editable} (or something like this
5. editing  table cells (esp. for complex content) on their own might be useful.  For this, a right-click item of some sort would be required, as not to clutter the table with 'edit' buttons. Alternatively, suggestion 4 might mean this is not required.
6. any other {div} / {span} or other sectional tags could have an optional {tag:edit=true} field that feeds thier content into the 'sub-section' editor.  In fact, you could probably overload this parameter for ALL block plugins (with the default, of course, being edit=false).

This enhancement would have the added benefit to alleviate some of the rednering complaints of the WYSIWYG editor that people are reporting as plugin macros are added and are not rendered in a way which is pretty for 'end-end-users'.  Instead, 'simple' users would be able to simply edit the blocks they understand and have been given the 'edit' button, while more advanced users might edit an entire section, or the entire page.

mediawiki, as seen at wikipedia, does this quite well for paragraph headers.  My suggestions here abstract that to one step higher to include other types of sections.

This is related to some requests for new features where the users wants the preview / editor to 'jump' to the section being edited, but is perhaps a more elegant solution.
fields.summary: Sectional Editing

fields.description:
As originally described in: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-2337

In Confluence search toppage, Japanese double byte query cannot be sent correctly. It works correctly with the search box in global header. The search box in the search toppage might be sending a query in non UTF-8 encoding. 

Although a temporary fix was described (as below) I believe we still need to improve something here.

TEMPORARY FIX:

You need to set the URIEncoding attribute of the Connector tag in server.xml to UTF-8:

e.g. <Connector className="org.apache.coyote.tomcat4.CoyoteConnector" port="8080" minProcessors="5" maxProcessors="75"
            enableLookups="true" redirectPort="8443" acceptCount="10" debug="0" connectionTimeout="20000" useURIValidationHack="false"
            URIEncoding="UTF-8"/>
fields.summary: japanese character search input does not send correct query

fields.description:
I've been testing out Dan's EAR/WAR install of Confluence on our development server and wanted a place to post any feedback, hence this JIRA issue :)

First of all, there are some excellent improvements - it's looking really nice.

The only minor gripes I have at present are:

When creating a space (great work on the new UI!) there are options that say:

* All users - anyone logged into Confluence 

Would it be possible to change that to:

* Registered users - anyone logged into Confluence

Many of our client will assume that "All users" means "everyone" (even though there is an anonymous users option below). Stating "Registered users" would make it that little bit clearer as to what it means.

---------------------------

Is there any way to disable the "In Confluence's configured database" option on the attachment admin settings? In our hosted environment we will be using various file storage mechanisms (eventually moving file storage for our shared hosting on to a separate server, etc) and want to prevent users storing attachments in the db (albeit the db then simply stores the blobs on disk) just to keep things straightforward.
fields.summary: Confluence 2.2 - feedback

fields.description: Currently a logged in user only has right explicitly granted him/her or a group to which they belong. Logged in users should also have all the rights granted to anonymous users. For example, if anonymous users have view acccess to a space then all logged in users should also have view access. In other words, logged in users access rights should be OR'ed with anonymous users' rights.
fields.summary: Logged in users should inherit access rights of anonymous users.

fields.description: the {include} macro can be useful for creating mixed public/private page content (is there some other way to do this?).  So if I'm making my personal page, I want our company to see my phone numbers, but not anonymous users.  I did this by creating a public space, putting my page there, then using {include} to include my "phone number" page back in the corporate (private) space.  The problem is when I'm anonymous, I see the "unable to render" area where the include was.  I'd like it to just be invisible.
fields.summary: {include} macro should be optionally invisible

fields.description:
This was a change request for the Linking Plugin [LINK-39] but might require a change to removepage.action to make it work.  Currently, it's quite user-UNfriendly in that the removepage.action dumps you at the page index after a delete!

= 8< ==================== snip ==================== >8 ==
I know that this is likely difficult, and perhaps impossible without modifying confluence code, but if possible, it would be great to specify in the parameters the destination that you would like the browser to navigate to AFTER the 'remove'is done.

If the 'remove' page is NOT the current page, the default destination should be the current page.

If the 'remove' page IS the current page, the default destination should be the parent page.

If a destination is specified, go to that page instead (if it still exists after the 'remove', otherwise use default behaviour)

I will echo this change request to confluence for their removepage.action.
= 8< ==================== snip ==================== >8 ==
fields.summary: removepage.action should return to @parent / @self or another specified target after remove

fields.description:
The ability to create merged table cells (e.g. having a heading in one cell above two cells) would be quite handy when creating more complex tables in Confluence.

An example of a merged cell (oriented horizontally) is attached.
fields.summary: Add the ability to create merged table cells

fields.description:
When I go from edit mode to preview, frequently formatting characters are backslashed.  In this example an attached image (which I was not even editing at the time) was backslashed:

Before edit (Wiki Markup):
!060404 BLI58-6 trans spectrum.jpg|thumbnail,align=center!

Preview: The image has now vanished and been replaced by this:
!060404 BLI58-6 trans spectrum.jpg|thumbnail,align=center!

Wiki Markup after looking at Preview:
\!060404 BLI58-6 trans spectrum.jpg\|thumbnail,align=center\!

I just stared playing with Confluence this morning, and this has happened to me 3 times, twice with attached images and once with a line encoded as *bold* (which changed to \*bold\* after a preview).  I haven't seen this bug listed elsewhere.  For us it would be a show stopper, it's crippling to an easily editable wiki of editing it can randomly destroy the formatting, so I hope there is a simple solution because I'm trying to talk my group into using a Wiki (possibly Confluence) for our next project.

Thanks.
fields.summary: editor preview adds unwanted backslashes

fields.description:
If you switch from the wiki markup editor to the rich text editor and then back, some of the backslashes used to escape special characters are dropped.

To reproduce: enter the following text on a page
{noformat}
;; simple Lisp function
(lambda \(x) x)  ;;  backslash necessary to prevent this becoming the smiley (x)
escape a curly brace: \{foo.
{noformat}

Save the page.  Edit as wiki markup, then switch to rich text, and back to wiki markup.  The first backslash is gone, so the code doesn't render appropriately, but the second one is preserved.

Note that the rich text editor does preserve all backslashes inside a \{noformat} block.  That's not really enough, though: I'd like to be able to write small code snippets inline without the visual overhead of the panel or the space.  A bigger issue, of course, is that switching between the two editing modes needs to preserve all content and all markup (however it may be displayed on the screen).
fields.summary: Switching between editing modes doesn't preserve backslash escapes

fields.description:
when viewing / previewing a standard page:

\ renders as \
{ renders as  a unmatched macro tag
\{ renders as {
\\ renders as a new line
\\{ renders as \ and then an unmatched macro tag
\\\{ renders as \\\{

* There is no way to render \{ in plain text
fields.summary: escape sequence \\\{ renders improperly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-5893].
  {panel}


- I create a comment, e.g. on page A
- in this comment I add a link to another page, e.g. page X
- page A: Info should show page X as an outgoing link
- page X: Info should show page A as an incoming link
- neither outgoing nor incoming links is updated
- reindexing does not update the index either
fields.summary: Using a link to a page in a comment should update outgoing / incoming links

fields.description:
When I create a template, I cannot insert form fields into links or macros. For example, when I use the following code,

{clickable:@page_name@}

Confluence tries to render this macro and tells me that "@page_name@ does not exist". It would make more sense to suppress rendering of Macros on the template page, and allow the user to insert the variables. 

As for links, it would be great to be able to insert form fields into the "URL" portion of the link code. To do this, I had to use the following workaround:

[existing online help|] @page_filename@ @manual]

This code allows the user to insert the page name. Afterwards, in the Wiki markup, the user deletes the internal brace and the spaces, and gets a working link. I wish this could happen without the workaround.
fields.summary: Inserting form fields into links and macros

fields.description: When moving a page with children around in a space, the "Move children?" option remains disabled. This results in the pages children being separated from there parent. This is a sad sad occasion and should be fixed before more innocents are needlessly harmed.
fields.summary: "Move children?" is disabled when moving a page within a space

fields.description: On a page that you can not edit, a small sliver of the yellow background from the edit label link can be seen. You can not do anything with it, but it should not be there.
fields.summary: The background of the  label edit span shows when you dont have permission to create a label

fields.description:
Whilst doing some heavy editing, I have from time to time got warnings such as:

"A version of this page you were editing at Apr 10, 2006 19:08 was not saved. The page has since been updated. The changes made conflict with your changes and cannot be merged. Do you want to  view the conflict  or discard your changes?"

when I am sure I saved the page after the mentioned edit.  The first one or two times, I figured the message was probably right, and I was just crazy.  But after seeing it many times, I am sure there is a problem here.  Unfortunately, I have not been able to narrow down exactly when this occurs.  It does not seem to happen every time I edit a page.  I guess this message originates from draft autosaving, which would happen at regular intervals.  Perhaps if an autosave happens at an inopportune moment this bug is triggered.

I have also seen a variant of the warning about unsaved newly-added pages.  I presume the cause is the same.

If it were just a spurious message, this might not be a big deal.  However, if a user believes the message and merges the "unsaved" edits, the page can be corrupted.  I had the unfortunate experience of doing this once, and ended up with a page with duplicated content interleaved by the merge.  If you like, I can dig up a diff for the incorrect merge.
fields.summary: Spurious "was not saved" warnings

fields.description: empty documents are indexed incorrect
fields.summary: Search or indexing is not working correctly with empty documents

fields.description: The Links section of the notation guide should mention that headings have anchors by default.  Nice feature, but I had to ask my resident ex-Confluence developer to find out about it!  Remember, "Links are the heart of Confluence" ;).
fields.summary: Notation guide should mention headings create anchors

fields.description: Semantic markup for the page title is preferable for accessibility and search engine optimisation. We should use H1, and override all default styles so it looks the same.
fields.summary: Put page title in H1 tag

fields.description: It would be good if you could remove profile pictures after they're uploaded. Also, the cancel button on the upload form doesn't seem to do anything; the profile picture is still applied.
fields.summary: Allow removal of uploaded profile pictures
Page history should have "annotated" view

fields.description:
We use spaces for projects and when the project is complete, we would like to move the space out of the way by putting it on its own "Archived" tab on the dashboard.

Setting the archive flag would be a space admin capability.  

When the archive flag is set, it would automatically:
- change the permissions of anyone who is not an admin to view only
- cause the space to show up on the (new) "Archived" tab on the dashboard and remove it from every other tab
- default to not including the space when searching, but add "Archived Spaces" as another type of content to include on the search screen
fields.summary: The ability to archive or inactivate a space
Function "Configure your Issue Navigator " also for Sub Tasks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-5875].
  {panel}

Hi,

our company also want to use Confluence 2.1.x. 

But we have an issue:

Intranet Integration

All Users für web based Applications have a single URL
https://intranet.mycompany.com running apache 2.0.x and mod_auth_ldap.

Currently, all intranet apllications are using the environment variable
REMOTE_USER for user mapping which is passed from apache through
the webserver module to the java/php/perl application.

Once, the user is logged in, everything is fine.
The java/php/perl application knows the
user = REMOTE_USER and can make the necessary
LDAP Requests for the user.

Login screens for Apllcations are not necessary at all.
For mediawiki, there's an example in the Extension "Auto_Login_via_REMOTE_USER".



It would be great, to have a configuration variable like

REMOTE_USER=true within the Confluence Web Admin

to use this simple feature in Confluence and
to make it simple to integrate in existing Intranet and Extranet Environments.

Of course, it's necessary to configure confluence LDAP integration, that 
confluence uses the same user oids as the apache mod_auth_ldap.

Regards, Thorleif Wiik
fields.summary: SSO with apache REMOTE_USER

fields.description:
My users constantly complain that they get too many 'incorrect' results for their query when they make multi-word queries. The problem is that they are used to internet search where the words will be AND-ed together by default. As it stands they get huge numbers of irrelevant matches which makes them start to not trust search. Can you imagine if Google used "OR" for its search queries? Almost every site on the web would be returned for multi-word queries!

e.g. If I search for "andy armstrong pantero" on Google I get 139 results. Switching to OR matching I get 378,000,000 results!!!

Some possibilities here include:
1. Make AND be the default
2. Provide a configuration option so that administrators can choose the default
3. Order search results by relevance so that the AND matches always come ahead of the OR matches

See this idea in the Confluence Community for more details:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DISC/search+exactly?focusedCommentId=169231#comment-169231
fields.summary: Search should use AND logic by default

fields.description:
There may be two separate feature requests here. Please create additional request if desired.

1) I've wonder if we could have something similar to the watch list in Jira where you can put people in the list to get notified when comments are added. 

We have engineers asking: Brent Eggleston 4/5/2006 8:13 AM 
I am planning on capturing and updating the confluence pages. Do you (included Charlie Smith) know of a way that the Confluence can notify specific individuals (push model instead of subscribe and publish) of certain topics? 

2)  It also would be nice if we could pop email comments to the Confluence pages much like can do with comments on Jira issues.  It's really fantastic. 


Charlie
4/6/06
fields.summary: Something similar to the watch list in Jira where you can put people in the list to get notified when comments are added

fields.description:
When I browse space using tree view of list pages, confluence doesn't display page name correctly if the page name is in Korean.
I did some trace with the source code and found that the response from confluence is cut before end. I thinks its encoding problem, again.

Confluence(Java) counts a foreign character (utf-8) as 1 character. As you know most of Korean characters are two-bytes. But when we receive the response, only the first half of that character is arrived.

This symptom also occurs when I use pagetree plugin. 

Refer to the screenshot-1. If there is a problem with rendering child pages, it always happens at the last one. May be the response was cut according the the byte count not character count.
fields.summary: In Tree View of List Pages, page name is not displayed when we use Korean characters.

fields.description:
In the Rich Text 'Add Link' dialog, going to a different page of the search results removes the textboxes and buttons required to complete the form.

Steps to reproduce on confluence.atlassian.com:

1. Add a new page in the TEST space.
2. Go to the Rich Text editor.
3. Click on the 'Add Link' button.
4. Search for something.
5. Click on page #2 of the search results.

The textboxes and buttons on the form disappear, and clicking on any of the search results causes a Javascript error.
fields.summary: Search result paging is broken for 'Add Link' dialog in Rich Text editor
